title: I am 12 and I have always wanted to be a K-pop idol, but I’m all American. I have a singing ability, learning dance, and I'm fluent in Korean. Do I still have the chance to become one? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. [Note-please read answer to the end or skim through at least.] Go for it. There’s no harm in trying. Audition for as many companies as you like. Of course, some will turn you down because *cough racism/bias* but you can sing, kinda dance, and know two of the three most important languages for k-pop idols (english, japanese, korean), so go ahead and try! Because if you don’t try you might regret it later on, but if you do, and even if you fail, at least you won’t regret. Here are some companies: *capital letters are artists/groups under that company YG One of the big three. Known for rap/hip-hop/swag/stage presence/great music, some foreigners, not many. BLACKPINK, BIGBANG, 2NE1, WINNER, IKON SM One of the big three. Known for strict training/amazing vocals/visuals, some/quite a few foreigners. NCT, RED VELVET, SHINEE, SNSD, JYP One of the big three. Known for personality/friendliness/genuine. Welcoming to foreigners. TWICE, GOT7, STRAY KIDS, ITZY, MISSAFantagio ASTRO, WEKI MEKI, Pledis SEVENTEEN, (ex)PRISTIN, Starship MONSTA X Yuehua EVERGLOWFNC SF9, AOA, N.FLYING, F.T.ISLAND, CNBLUE, CHERRY BULLET  Stone Music IZ*ONE, FROMIS9, WANNA ONE, X1, SHINHWA, I.O.I  Cube (G)-IDLE, PENTAGON, APINK, BTOBWoollim LOVELYZ, GOLDEN CHILD, INFINITE, ROCKET PUNCHDSP Media KARA, K.A.R.D, RAINBOW,KQ ATEEZBrandNew Music AB6IX Jellyfish VIXX, GUGUDAN, VERIVERY RBW (Rainbow Bridge World) MAMAMOO, ONEUS, ONEWE, You can search up company names online to find their audition information. Good luck! Remember to be yourself, have stage presence, be calm, don’t over or underdo it, etc. (and make sure to work on not only your singing/dancing but your korean skills, vocab and pronunciation, it will help your chances)

Yes? I’m assuming this is about the fact that you are American… Honestly, here’s the tea… You do not have to be Korean to enjoy K-pop music. K-pop is a genre. It is a style of music. It is not music made by artists of a certain ethnicity. Yes, K-pop originated in South Korea and is built around the culture of it’s parent country, but it is a global style of music. I have people at my school who love K-pop and I live in rural Australia!! If you are talented, have the right connections, know your music and are enthusiastic about your career, you have just as much shot at fame an artist in any other genre. Plus, if you make it big, you could create a statement from your ethnicity (similar to Eminem and the rap scene) I honestly think you’re biggest hurdle here is the fact that you are young, and you’ll grow out of that… ^laughs at own joke^ Sorry, that was uncalled for… Seriously though, the fact that you are 12 is you’re biggest issue here. Keep to you’re goal and you’ll make it my friend!! Keep Living, Alex
